snippet: Sidelights to the day’s theme included a retracted remark by former Gov. John H. Sununu and former President George W. Bush’s book event in Texas during a visit by President Obama.
abstract: Pres Obama and presumptive Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney resume personal attacks on each other over the economy; policy debate has descended into angry accusations of twists and distortions; Romney campaigns in Pennsylvania, while Obama campaigns in Texas.

headline.main: Romney and Obama Resume Economic Attacks, Despite a Few Diversions
headline.print_headline: Romney and Obama Resume Economic Attacks, but There Are a Few Diversions

byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and PETER BAKER

snippet: The organization’s theory is that the more efficiently food is used in the developed world, the more food will be available for the developing world.
abstract: Oxfam says that it wants American women to think more about the impact their families' eating habits have on the environment and people in parts of the world where food is less abundant; advocates small changes in shopping, cooking and eating that could lead to positive changes in the global food chain.

headline.main: Oxfam Urges U.S. Women to Pursue Efficiency in Food Use
headline.print_headline: Oxfam Urges U.S. Women to Pursue Efficiency in Food Use

snippet: Analysts and shareholders are eager to see whether Marissa Mayer can lure back advertisers, reinvigorate a muddled brand and improve morale.
abstract: Marissa Mayer faces challenges as Yahoo's new chief executive, with analysts and shareholders eager to see if she can lure back advertisers, boost a muddled brand and improve company morale; Yahoo reports second quarter earnings that beat analysts' expectations, but revenue was was flat at $1.22 billion; net income for the second quarter fell 4.2 percent from a year earlier, to $228.5 million, or 18 cents a share.

headline.main: Yahoo Data Shows Depth of Challenge Mayer Faces
headline.print_headline: Yahoo Data Shows Depth Of Challenge Mayer Faces

byline.original: By NICOLE PERLROTH and TANZINA VEGA

snippet: To meet online competition, shopping malls are signing tenants that offer dining, hairstyling, craft-making and other things the Internet can’t provide.
abstract: Shopping malls are marketing 'experiences' in an effort to meet online competition that is cutting into their business; mall developers like Glimcher Realty Trust are experimenting with ways to make the sprawling centers Internet-proof, offering dining, hairstyling, craft-making and other activities that cannot be enjoyed online.

headline.main: Malls’ New Pitch: Come for the Experience
headline.print_headline: Malls’ New Pitch: Come for the Experience

snippet: One of the new perks in Apple's next version of iOS, the operating system for iPhones, is that people will be able to do FaceTime video calls over the cellular network. But a menu in an early version of the software suggests that AT&T is consideri...
abstract: One of the new perks in Apple's next version of iOS, the operating system for iPhones, is that people will be able to do FaceTime video calls over the cellular network. But a menu in an early version of the software suggests that AT&T is considering charging a separate fee for the privilege.

headline.main: Will AT&T Charge for FaceTime on the iPhone?

snippet: Microsoft redesigned its Office applications to take advantage of trends like touch-based devices, social networking and cloud computing.
abstract: Microsoft unveils its next version of Office, which is redesigned to take advantage of trends like touch-based devices, social networking and cloud computing; analysts agree Microsoft is making bold changes with the product, but company leaves unanswered some key questions about its plans, including how much it will charge for the software and when it plans to release it in its final form.

headline.main: In Nod to New Era, Microsoft Unveils Touch-Based Version of Office
headline.print_headline: In Nod to New Era, Microsoft Unveils Touch-Based Version of Office

snippet: Recent architectural trends have spawned apartment buildings both taller and glassier than in years past, making the cleaning services busier.
abstract: Elizabeth A Harris The Appraisal column on recent architectural trends in New York City that have spawned taller apartment buildings with larger expanses of glass, keeping window cleaning services busier than ever.

headline.main: Window Washers Enjoy Surge in Demand
headline.print_headline: As Shiny Towers Fill the Skyline, Window Washers Get Job Security
